abstract.t: This document describes the ICMPv6 Reflection utility. ICMPv6 Reflection uses a request-response handshake that is similar to ICMPv6 Echo, except that after a request is sent, the corresponding reply includes the request message itself or a subset of its fields as specified in the request. Specifically, the IPv6 header of the request message and its IPv6 extension headers, if they are present, can be included in the reply. Network operators can use ICMPv6 Reflection to determine how IPv6 extension headers have been altered by transit nodes.
